summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 5320, entitled "An Ordinance licensing persons who sell, offer to attempt to sell goods and merchandise by selling trading stamps, checks, tickets, or other thing of whatever name to merchants, the same by such merchants being delivered to customers upon the purchase of goods and merchandise, and then exchanged by such customers with the person selling such trading stamps, checks, tickets, or other thing of whatever name for his goods and merchandise, and merchants who use or deal in such trading stamps, checks, tickets, or other thing of whatever name, and providing a penalty for any violation of the same", approved April 25, 1899.
